infos.value: ...Nngh!
They've certainly earned the moniker of the "Wolves of the North." Escaping the castle will be no small feat.
Your wounds... Are they okay?
Yes. Yet it is rather difficult to coordinate with another kingdom's commander.
Forgive me...
You misunderstand me.
At this rate, the surrounding enemies will envelope us.
We must open an escape route before that happens.
Do you have a plan?
I will hold the rear.
You intend to sacrifice yourself so that we may flee.
Alas, I see no other way.
I won't allow it... I won't leave a friend behind!
I am honored that you think of me as a friend.
Of course I do!
Then I shall speak so as well.
For my friend...for my cherished friend, I will stay behind.
Schuzelt...
N-no, wait! To allow such—
I beheld Leonis Castle with mine own eyes just once.
But I understood well enough. That castle's walls run high and thick.
You understand, Lord Mont? Only you will be able to free Lady Machérie from that prison.
Schuzelt...
There is no time to waste. I beg of you...make for Leonis Castle at once!
Before it is too late!
You need not worry about me.
A man such as Khury would know that I am far more valuable as a hostage to trade with Hourne.
I shall surrender when the time is right.
You've...made up your mind, then?
Yes.
Understood. We are in your debt.
Leave it to me.
Mark my words... We will come back for you!
...Yes.
Lord Schuzelt...
I've heard whispers of you.
The Blunt Lancer. They say that frigid white fang of a lance you carry can pierce even steel...
What bombast you have heard.
...I see.
When you laid your assault upon us...you were clearly holding back.
I thought it strange—that Wezette's first division, the great «Equito», could be so weak...
I do not loathe the idea of having compassion for one's enemies...but such kindness will come back to haunt you.
You advice is well taken.
Now, observe...
...The art of the spear that I have perfected in this frostbitten prison!
